parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
From basileus; properly, royalty, i.e. rule, or a realm.
A priest, one who offers sacrifice to a god (in Jewish and pagan religions; of Christians only met.). From hieros; a priest.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From the base of dokeo; glory, in a wide application.
Dominion, strength, power; a mighty deed. Perhaps a primary word; vigor.
From the same as aei; properly, an age; by extension, perpetuity; by implication, the world; specially a Messianic period.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From the same as aei; properly, an age; by extension, perpetuity; by implication, the world; specially a Messianic period.
Of Hebrew origin; properly, firm, i.e. trustworthy; adverbially, surely.
